t: Isaiah 65
Judgment and Salvation
I*pn was ready to be sought by those who did not ask for me; I*ld was ready to be found by those who did not seek me. I*ln said, “Here I am, here I am,” to*ld a nation that was not called by my name.
I*ln spread out my hands all the day to*ld a rebellious people, who*ln walk in a way that is not good, following*ld their own devices;
a*ln people who provoke me to*ld my face continually, sacrificing*ln in gardens and*ld making offerings on bricks;
who*ln sit in tombs, and*ld spend the night in secret places; who*ln eat pig’s flesh, and*ld broth of tainted meat is in their vessels;
who*ln say, “Keep to yourself, do*ld not come near me, for I am too holy for you.” These*ln are a smoke in my nostrils, a*ld fire that burns all the day.
Behold,*ln it is written before me: “I*ld will not keep silent, but I will repay; I*ln will indeed repay into their lap

both*ld your iniquities and your fathers’ iniquities together, says*l the Lord;*s because*ln they made offerings on the mountains and*ld insulted me on the hills, I*ln will measure into their lap payment*ld for their former deeds.”

Thus*pn says the Lord:*s “As*ln the new wine is found in the cluster, and*ld they say, ‘Do not destroy it, for*ld there is a blessing in it,’ so*ln I will do for my servants’ sake, and*ld not destroy them all.
I*ln will bring forth offspring from Jacob, and*ld from Judah possessors of my mountains; my*ln chosen shall possess it, and*ld my servants shall dwell there.
Sharon*ln shall become a pasture for flocks, and*ld the Valley of Achor a place for herds to lie down, for*ld my people who have sought me.
But*ln you who forsake the Lord,*s who*ld forget my holy mountain, who*ln set a table for Fortune and*ld fill cups of mixed wine for Destiny,

I*ln will destine you to the sword, and*ld all of you shall bow down to the slaughter, because,*ln when I called, you did not answer; when*ld I spoke, you did not listen, but*ln you did what was evil in my eyes and*ld chose what I did not delight in.”

Therefore*pn thus says the Lord God:*s “Behold,*ln my servants shall eat, but*ld you shall be hungry; behold,*ln my servants shall drink, but*ld you shall be thirsty; behold,*ln my servants shall rejoice, but*ld you shall be put to shame;
behold,*ln my servants shall sing for gladness of heart, but*ld you shall cry out for pain of heart and*ld shall wail for breaking of spirit.
You*ln shall leave your name to my chosen for a curse, and*ld the Lord God*s will put you to death, but*ld his servants he will call by another name,

so*ln that he who blesses himself in the land shall*ld bless himself by the God of truth, and*ln he who takes an oath in the land shall*ld swear by the God of truth; because*ln the former troubles are forgotten and*ld are hidden from my eyes.
New Heavens and a New Earth
“For*pn behold, I create new heavens and*ld a new earth, and*ln the former things shall not be remembered or*ld come into mind.
But*ln be glad and rejoice forever in*ld that which I create; for*ln behold, I create Jerusalem to be a joy, and*ld her people to be a gladness.
I*ln will rejoice in Jerusalem and*ld be glad in my people; no*ln more shall be heard in it the sound of weeping and*ld the cry of distress.

No*ln more shall there be in it an*ld infant who lives but a few days, or*ld an old man who does not fill out his days, for*ln the young man shall die a hundred years old, and*ld the sinner a hundred years old shall be accursed.
They*ln shall build houses and inhabit them; they*ld shall plant vineyards and eat their fruit.

They*ln shall not build and another inhabit; they*ld shall not plant and another eat; for*ln like the days of a tree shall the days of my people be, and*ld my chosen shall long enjoy the work of their hands.
They*ln shall not labor in vain or*ld bear children for calamity, for*ln they shall be the offspring of the blessed of the Lord,*s and*ld their descendants with them.
Before*ln they call I will answer; while*ld they are yet speaking I will hear.

The*ln wolf and the lamb shall graze together; the*ld lion shall eat straw like the ox, and*ld dust shall be the serpent’s food. They*ln shall not hurt or destroy in*ld all my holy mountain,” says*l the Lord.*s
